page.title: 13Schools in Irthlingborough
page.content: At the present time, schools in Irthlingborough consist of an infant school, a junior school and a comprehensive school. There have been schools of some sort in the town since the 14th century but schools as we know them started in the 18th century. This was St. Peter's Church School and the instruction had to include reading, knitting and spinning. This was a charity school, which, in 1830 became Irthlingborough National School. In 1877 Irthlingborough Board School was opened. In 1897, a separate infant school was opened on an adjoining site, both schools still use the same buildings today. Both buildings have, of course, been modernised a little since then.
